action.action-desc: Mr. Moylan introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To extend the supplemental security income program to Guam, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Katrina and Leslie Schaller Act.

section.header: Extension of the supplemental security income program to Guam

subsection.text: Section 303(b) of the Social Security Amendments of 1972 (86 Stat. 1484) is amended by striking , Guam,.

paragraph.header: Guam included in definition of State for purposes of certain programs
paragraph.text: Section 1101(a)(1) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1301(a)(1)) is amended in the 5th sentence, by striking , the Virgin Islands, and Guam each place it appears and inserting and the Virgin Islands.

paragraph.header: Elimination of limit on total payments to Guam under certain programs
paragraph.text: Section 1108 of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1308) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking , Guam,; and

clause.text: in paragraph (1), by striking , Guam,; and
in paragraph (4), by striking subparagraph (B) and redesignating subparagraphs (C) and (D) as subparagraphs (B) and (C), respectively.

paragraph.header: Guam included in geographic meaning of United States under the SSI program
paragraph.text: Section 1614(e) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 1382c(e)) is amended by striking and the District of Columbia and inserting , the District of Columbia and Guam.

subsection.text: The Commissioner of Social Security may waive or modify any statutory requirement relating to the provision of benefits under the Supplemental Security Income Program under title XVI of the Social Security Act in Guam, to the extent that the Commissioner deems it necessary in order to adapt the program to the needs of Guam.
This section and the amendments made by this section shall take effect on the 1st day of the 1st Federal fiscal year that begins 1 year or more after the date of the enactment of this Act.
